page.title: 04Mr.Bainbridge-Dairy Farmer
page.content: Mr.Bainbridge farms 270 acres at Home Farm Cumwhinton. He milks 275 cows,20 cows are dry and there are 150 young animals (i.e.heifers and calves) The system he uses is called zero graze because the food is brought to the cows. He milks his cows in a low line herring bone parlour. 28 cows come into the parlour, 14 on each side. The udders are washed with warm water, the clusters are put on and after the cows have been milked the teats are sprayed with a chemical to stop any germs entering. The milk is taken to the collecting tanks and cooled. There are 3 tanks. They hold 550,1000 and 440 gallons of milk the smallest being used as an overflow.After milking the tanks are washed out with 100 gallons of cold water followed by 80 gallons of boiling water.
